channel.title: Newsletters on Stop this train
channel.description: Recent content in Newsletters on Stop this train

item.title: Week 10/05/2020 - 10/11/2020
item.description: Monday Oct.5th, 2020 Cooler Screens raises $80 million to bring interactive screens into cooler aisles. Regeneron stock rises 7% because of the presidential treatment. Facebook brings shopping functions into Instagram’s IGTV videos and plans to test it on Reels. Tuesday Oct.6th, 2020 U.S. trade deficit ($67.1 billion) grew to its highest level in 14 years. Stocks fell sharply since President Trump announced that he would halt negotiations on COVID stimulus relief until after the election.

item.title: Week 09/14/2020 - 09/20/2020
item.description: Monday Sep.14th, 2020 TikTok chose Oracle as its American partner. They want to partner to become a “trusted technology provider”. (Oracle would house data from TikTok users on its own cloud servers to alleviate national security concerns) Delta is losing 27 million per day and the government airline bailout funds will run out on Oct.1st. As a solution, it decided to use its SkyMiles program to raise $6.5 billion. Pepsi promoted its new enhanced water beverage called Driftwell which alleges to help people sleep better.

item.title: Week 09/07/2020 - 09/13/2020
item.description: Monday Sep.7th, 2020 US debt reached its highest level relative to the size of the economy since WWII. Tesla gets rejected and didn’t get into the S&P 500 index. SoftBank fell more than 7% since it was betting on American big tech companies (Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook). Germany’s foreign minister threatened to reconsider the nultibillion gas project if Russia doesn’t cooperate with an investigation into the poisoning of Alexey Navalny, the prominent Putin critic.

item.title: Week 08/24/2020 - 08/30/2020
item.description: Monday Aug.24th, 2020 TikTok sues the US government over Trump’s ban, saying it didn’t get a fair shot to prove it’s not a national security threat. Luminar is going public in a $3.4B merger. Luminar makes lidar tech that allows self-driving cars to measure the distances between the cars and their surroundings. Palantir’s IPO paperwork was leaked. Tuesday Aug.25th, 2020 American Airlines says it will lay off or involuntarily furlough 19,000 employees as of October 1 unless the airline industry gets more help from Congress.

item.title: Week 08/17/2020 - 08/23/2020
item.description: Monday Aug.17th, 2020 The Nasdaq advanced 1% to 11129.73, hitting an all-time high. The S&P 500 rose slightly but fell short of a record closing high once again amid declining trading volumes and lingering concerns over a U.S. coronavirus stimulus bill. Bitcoin’s price went past $12000 to its highest level. Robinhood announced a $200 million Series G round. The Trump administration approved to open Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to drilling for oil and gas.

item.title: Week 08/10/2020 - 08/16/2020
item.description: Monday Aug.10th, 2020 Uber and Lyft ordered by California judge to classify drivers as employees. The injunction is stayed for 10 days, however, giving Uber and Lyft an opportunity to appeal the decision. Uber said it planned to file an immediate emergency appeal to block the ruling from going into effect. Simon Property Group, the states’ largest mall landlord, reported its $1.1 billion revenue (declined 24%) in Q2 due to the failure of collecting all rents and also the covid-19 closure.

item.title: Week 08/03/2020 - 08/09/2020
item.description: Monday Aug.3rd, 2020 Chinses government and citizens attacked both U.S. government and ByteDance. The Communist Party accused the force sale of “hunting and looting” of TikTok. Chinese social users accused ByteDance of ceasing to fight with U.S. Government. Google announced to buy 6.6% stake in home security companyADT for $450 million. ADT will assure the installation and maintenance of Google’s Nest line of home security devices. Also, Google will promote a trio of new Pixel smartphones.

item.title: Week 07/27/2020 - 08/02/2020
item.description: Monday Jul.27th, 2020 Senate Republicans proposed a $1 trillion coronavirus aid package and called this act “HEALS Act”. The ICE U.S. Dollar Index DXY, 0.07% slipped to a two-year low below 94.00. Google will keep its employees home until at least next July. Biotech firm Moderna got extra $472 million in COVID-19 vaccine funding from the US government. Also, it cooperates with the National Institutes of Health to begin one of the first large study of COVID-19.

item.title: Week 07/20/2020 - 07/26/2020
item.description: Monday Jul.20th, 2020 A Covid-19 vaccine developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca caused an immune response in a study of roughly 1000 patients (Patients have mild to moderate side effects including fever, headaches and muscle pain). Besides, another study coducted by Chinese Cansino also showed positve antibody responses in a Phase 2 trial. Although it’s still early, WHO said the states may have a deal with AstraZeneca and produce 300 million doses this fall if the results are still good.

item.title: Week 07/13/2020 - 07/19/2020
item.description: Wednesday Jun.15th, 2020 S&P 500, Dow Jones and Nasdaq were back to positive. Goldman Sachs reported a 150% spike in trading revenues. Many blue check accounts(including Bill Gates, Elon Musk, Barack Obama, Joe Biden etc.) in Twitter were hacked by bitcoin spammers. It took hours to go back to normal. Twitter’s stock fell 3%. Walmart requires customers to wear masks. Zoom revealed a $599 work from home package including a tablet, 8 microphones and 3 cameras.
